results:
Based on my search results, I can provide you with information about academic resources for "The Great Gatsby" including scholarly articles, literary criticism, and dissertations available through databases like JSTOR and MLA. Here's what I found:

## Key Academic Databases and Resources

The MLA International Bibliography module adds citations for hundreds of thousands of books, articles and dissertations from 1926 to the present, linked to full text where available. This is one of the primary databases for literary research on "The Great Gatsby."

Literature databases provide access to biographical information, overviews, full-text literary criticism and reviews on more than 130,000 writers in all disciplines, from all time periods and from around the world.

## Sample Scholarly Articles and Citations

Several academic articles were mentioned in the search results:

1. Weinstein, Arnold. "Fiction as Greatness: The Case of Gatsby." NOVEL: A Forum on Fiction, vol. 19, no. 1, 1985, pp. 22-38. JSTOR, www.jstor.org/stable/1345714.

2. McAdams, Tony. "'The Great Gatsby' as a Business Ethics Inquiry." Journal of Business Ethics, vol. 12, no. 8, 1993, pp. 653-60. JSTOR, www.jstor.org/stable/25072450.

3. Giltrow, Janet, and David Stouck. "Style as politics in 'The Great Gatsby.'" Studies in the Novel, vol. 29, no. 4, winter 1997, pp. 476+. Gale Academic OneFile, link.gale.com/apps/doc/A20350592/AONE?u=tel_a_etsul&sid=bookmark-AONE&xid=43f97a39.

## Critical Essay Collections

The search results also revealed several important critical essay collections:

1. The Great Gatsby, by F. Scott Fitzgerald by Morris Dickstein (Editor); Salem Press Staff ... This volume of criticism begins with essays that provide the reader with cultural, historical, comparative, and critical contexts for understanding Gatsby.

2. The structure of The great Gatsby / Kenneth Eble -- Scott Fitzgerald's criticism of America / Marius Bewley -- Two versions of the hero / David Parker -- Gatsby and the failure of the omniscient "I" / Ron Neuhaus -- Another reading of The great Gatsby / Keath Fraser -- Oral aggression and splitting / A. B. Paulson -- The great Gatsby / Brian Way -- The waste land myth and symbols in The great Gatsby / Letha Audhuy.

3. Donaldson, Scott. "The Trouble with Nick: Reading Gatsby Closely." F. Scott Fitzgerald's The Great Gatsby, edited by Harold Bloom, Infobase, ... Additionally, Donaldson edited Critical Essays on F. Scott Fitzgerald's The Great Gatsby.

## Academic Bibliography Resources

This Squid Ink Classic of the Great Gatsby includes the full text of the work plus MLA style citations for scholarly secondary sources, peer-reviewed journal articles and critical academic research essays. Perfect for when your teacher requires extra resources in MLA format for your research paper.Includes:•Over 100 Literary Critiques citations•A detailed biography of the author•Historical content•Unique images from the 1920s

## Research Recommendations

How to use the literary databases and books critiquing The Great Gatsby / F. Scott Fitzgerald · Literary Reference Center, Literature Resource Center

For comprehensive research, scholars recommend using:
- JSTOR for accessing peer-reviewed articles
- MLA International Bibliography for comprehensive literary criticism citations
- Gale Academic OneFile for additional scholarly resources
- Literature Resource Center for biographical and critical information

The search results indicate that there is extensive scholarly work available on "The Great Gatsby" across multiple academic databases, with particular strength in JSTOR and MLA Bibliography for finding dissertations, peer-reviewed articles, and critical essays on various aspects of Fitzgerald's novel.
